content: This hatred of western civilization will not and can not be won in an attempt to Change a culture. Once we expanded into Iraq and declared an Ideological global war that cemented the hatred and rallied every sleeping Arab muslim in the world. Had we dealt Afganistan a punishing blow that would have set them back a hundred years and then left,We would have been far better off. It would have been considered a retalitory strike by the super power and a warning to the next nation of what happens when you anger America. But by playing these hearts and mind games and surges then rebuilding the whole country,8 years and no win in sight,They are emboldened and hate us more than ever they consider us weak. They mock us and laugh at us being divided vulnerable, broke, and weakened militarily. And once we leave they will go back to sq one and bask in the glory that they defeated the giant Infidel. So what are the choices at this point? "http://www.tangle.com/view_video.php?viewkey=0861ff3eabea1ceb73e4"

content: Radical Islam is truely the scourge of the Earth. While I usually can't stomach the tripe that comes from the religious right or the Foxnews type Republican, they only worry me because they're misinformed or just plain dumb. These Muslim religious nuts on the other hand, are truly civilization's greatest threat. There is no other group in the world that has ever claimed the desire to obtain nuclear weapons in order to actually use them. Only radical islamists. I am proud Barack Hussein Obama is our President and I'm counting on him to take a pragmatic approach to this problem, like he usually does on all things. I could use a break from the George W. Bush born evangelical again ideology when it comes to foreign policy.

content: After thirty some years of STATE SPONSORED terrorism when is it all right, O.K., justified, Approved by YOU to strike BACK!!! Did you approve of Afghanistan at first and now are criticising only after the known resultys are in or were you cheering them on when we were killing them any way we could?? After all how much of a strike would have been enough?? A burned tent and a couple of dead camels?? A dead janitor in an aspirin factory?? How much would have been enough?? AND, just WHO SPECIFICALLY would YOU have killed?? Kabul, Tora Bora? Carpet bomb the entire northeastern section of A-Stan WHO??? WHERE??? How many???? Would you have termed a strike of sufficient strenghth to "teach a lesson" or in the present day euphemism "send a message" The military is to kill people and break things, it IS NOT for delivering messages, or the Pizza, as in the Clinton administration!!!!

content: The ONLY justification needed is that over one million American and allied casualties were expected with the invasion of Japan. The incendiary bombing of her cities and towns, had all but eliminated the true ability to resist. BUT, the invasion of Okinawa proved that fanatical resistance was to be expected when invasion of Japanese soil was contemplated. Also the taking of Iwo Jima proved this as well. The brutality of the Japanese toward their own soldiers as a form of "discipline" was noted as well in these considerations and is what led to the decision to use the bomb. As I mentioned, the fire bombing of Tokyo and Okohama as well as Kyoto killed approx. three times as many human beings, as the a- bombs did and that is just three of the cities that were so bombed, with incendiaries. The fire bombing of Dresden and Hamburg in germany, also killed more human beings than either of the or both of the A-bombs did. These are facts. Easily researched and then it must be remembered, we didn't start the war and, the tenor of the times. If for instance we had used a nuclear weapon on Kabul for the attacks on the towers THAT would have been unconcienable. Quite frankly, I was concerned, VERY concerned, that we would do just that. As when G.W.B. somewhat intemperately used the phrase "clear and present danger" When he gave the ulimatum to the Taliban government about turning over those responsible for the attack on Afghanistan's soil, or we would retaliate with "every means at our command" THAT was scary stuff!! T

content: Radical Islam is a trend that has been growing for at least the last 60 years. It has taken hold across the world. It is very unfortunate because the majority of Muslims are like the majority of people everywhere, good, honest, and kind. The thing is we should know by now that fighting counter insurgencies is difficult. We will never be able to kill enough terrorists to make ourselves completely safe from terrorist attacks.

content: quote: Quite frankly, I was concerned, VERY concerned, that we would do just that. As when G.W.B. somewhat intemperately used the phrase "clear and present danger" When he gave the ulimatum to the Taliban government about turning over those responsible for the attack on Afghanistan's soil, or we would retaliate with "every means at our command" THAT was scary stuff!! I suppose your mindset leads you that way. The whole conspiracy around every turn/worse case scenerio thing. Few people gave any thought to an idea that we would use nuclear weapons in Afghanistan.
quote: Quite frankly, I was concerned, VERY concerned, that we would do just that. Few people gave any thought to an idea that we would use nuclear weapons in Afghanistan. I don't think we would either. According to Donald Rumsfeld, there weren't enough targets in Afghanistan.

content: quote: Originally posted by soscorpio: quote: Keep in mind that little Boy and Fat man were prototypes and better that we were the first to show the world the devastation of nuclear energy on an enemy so deserving of being the test subjects. Germany and Japan were well on thier way of developing the bomb and further advanced than we were we just beat them to it. It was inevitable someone would have used it and better us than them. You know you're trying logic on someone who thinks we should give America back to the indians and then jump in the ocean and drown. Of course Lib90 is waiting for others to do it first and then he will follow. No, he'll declare himself part native american and start shoving whites into the ocean.

content: quote: Originally posted by USNVet940: MOD HAT OFF quote: Originally posted by liberal90: quote: Originally posted by Boots_: There is no other group in the world that has ever claimed the desire to obtain nuclear weapons in order to actually use them. Only radical islamists. you mean beyond the united states right Oh, yeah! How dare the United States fight back against a treacherous, war-mongering nation who was talking "peace" out one side of their mouth while planning--and carrying out--a merciless war of conquest! How dare the United States use a weapon to bring a swift end to the most destructive war in human history! How dare the United States to not have needlessly sacrificed more of it's most valuable resource to appease wrist-wringers 60+ years later who decry the "inhumanity" of the use of the bomb! Thank you USNVet940! Well said!
